For the third or fourth time, it would depend on what that person was expecting for their money. If I was flying the family out from Green Bay for a week in sunny Southern California for our big vacation would I want to stay here: absolutely not. For a family vacation I would do the research and find a moderately priced (if money was a big concern) chain hotel around Hotel Circle where I would know exactly what to expect and which was close to all the attractions. If it was a couple I knew who were also coming down to SD for a weekend to see a ball game or run the Rock N Roll Marathon, I would have no problem suggesting it. My expectations may be lower than some. Unless I am specifically looking for a fancy, upscale place, I can deal with an old and outdated place if it is clean and the price is right. This isn't too say that some of the nightmare's you're reading about didn't happen but I cannot say they happened to me. I was far enough away from the circus at the pool that my wife and I both slept well before the marathon (something that, given the high stress level, could be tough at any hotel). I even used our free drink tickets Saturday afternoon and hung out on the patio overlooking the pool for a bit. So...at the end of the day, my suggestion is simple: If any of the things you've read, really worry you (noise, location, old rooms, etc), you should probably just find a Holiday Inn rather than risk being disappointed. If you want a fun place to cut loose at the pool and hang out with your friends on the cheap, you'll probably love it. I am in neither group and for me, the negative hype did not live up what I was expecting (thankfully!!!) and although it's far from the nicest place I've ever been, it is not even in the ballpark with the motel (national chain even) that I stayed at when I ran the marathon here in 2002 (but that is a horrible rant for another time!). Do the research and you'll make the right choice! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: azroadtrip
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the photos and description through the San Diego Zoo's preferred hotel package website. It looked like a beautiful old building, and sounded as though they'd done their best to preserve the original look and feel of the hotel of the stars! Only, their idea of preservation seems to be that they've never actually renovated anything except the facade and pool. The carpets were old. The couch and chair were stained, torn, and greasy. The towels were old and scratchy. The ceilings were cracked and badly patched. The TVs didn't work properly. The water went from scalding to freezing and back multiple times no matter where the knob was set. The bathroom floors were filthy. The a/c units rattled so loudly we couldn't sleep. The whole place smelled like an old folks' home. And the area of town! I didn't feel safe outside after dark, the street noise was extremely loud (as was the noise from the pool partiers), and the cops were called to the premises while we were there. The staff was less than helpful. While they did upgrade us to an executive king suite, they did not provide us with any information about using the phones, the continental breakfast, or the shuttle to the zoo (which we therefore missed). The cleaning staff spent half an hour banging on our door at 8 a.m. because they wanted to clean our room. Granted, we forgot to put out the "do not disturb" sign, but continuing to bang on the door that early in the morning because the deadbolt was thrown was just excessive. There were also signs in the windows giving notice of application for permits due to a change of management. I hope that the new owners turn this place around and make it as nice as it should be, but I definitely won't be back to find out.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!!”
Reviews.Author: vet0980
Reviews.Content: I have never been so unhappy in my life. I booked a room there when I got there the outside (which is on a busy street) looks okay but the rooms are horrible. I walked in and right out again and the biggest problem I paid with points that equal about $8000.00 and still have not got them back (17,200 for one night)..... please beware!! and the photos, maybe it looked like that once but this was an awful environment and the girls working the front desk talked more then they actually helped anyone. I hope in writing this people will start doing a little work before they book anything pictures can lie!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Bobkatevan
Reviews.Content: We booked same day through Orbitz. Checked in fine. Had to wait about 10 minutes, since Orbitz hadn't faxed in our reservation. Not a big deal. Yes, the hotel is old and needs to be remodeled, but we only paid $89 for one night and I thought this was a great deal to include breakfast. We checked in around 3 pm and spent one night. We were in room 328 and overlooked the road. The bed and room were clean. Large room. Shower initially was cold and was told the water heater broken earlier. Morning shower was nice and warm. Breakfast was fine, waffles, fruit, bagels, cereal, coffee, teas and juices. Check out was speedy. Parking was free and was easily accessible. I would stay here again for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: AB_Travel
Reviews.Content: I booked three nights at the Lafayette for my son and his girl friend - Jan 31-Feb 3. They are a frugal couple and not overly fussy. We read the reviews and checked out the location. The price and the location won out over the bad reviews. We thought people were too picky. Sorry. Should have listened to the bad reviews. My son was not happy. The first room was totally unacceptable - too loud because it was right beside the pool entrance. Second room was something they could stomach but still pretty bad. They just kept repeating, "It's only for 3 nights" The neighbourhood is run down and the hotel needs a major renovation. The walls are paper thin. My son sleeps soundly but the snoring in the next room woke him. Free breakfast is finished at 9:30 AM. Not a place to enjoy or to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent pool”
Reviews.Author: hershanator
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have been happier with our room w/ a pool view. The facility was clean and the atmosphere and staff were upbeat. Great food in the bar with a very cool bartender -'Fabian'. I had a wonderful Birthday:)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lafayette!”
Reviews.Author: pookie43
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four nights at this old southern plantation style, charming and historic hotel along with our 8 and 11 year old grandchildren. We all loved it. We were on the second floor -- double queen, poolside room with lanai. I would say pool view with french doors was key to our overall enjoyment. The room was clean and large enough to comfortably accommodate the two queen beds, a sofa bed, large table, ergonomic chair, 6 drawer dresser, tv, microwave, coffeemaker, fridge, hairdryer, lots of lighting, blackout drapes, in-room thermostatically controlled heat/ac.worked very well, bathroom dated, but everything worked. Cable tv reception not the greatest, in-room internet access, free local calls, lots of parking including underground secure area (we did not use this, we parked outisde). We enjoyed the poolside patio option for enjoying the continental breakfast which was included in the room rate -- so great/easy/fast with the children. The olympic-sized swimming pool, with complimentary pool towels, of course, was a hit.-- It was hard to get the children motivated to leave to see the local attractions. The staff was always courteous and responsive. We felt this hotel was a bargain and would definitley stay here if our travel plans take us to San Diego again. Hotel location was easy for getting to all attractions and was quiet, unlike what we've heard about Hotel Circle--and such a nice change from the cookie-cutter hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, nice little place”
Reviews.Author: john44pacnw
Reviews.Content: We booked with the property directly and because we did we received an upgraded room. While some of the common areas (halls, elevator) could use more cleaning, our room was clean and reasonably quiet. The location worked for us, 2 or 3 minutes drive to the wine bars and restaurants of Hillcrest. We liked it and found the staff very pleasant

Reviews.Title: “More than acceptable for the low rate and location”
Reviews.Author: pandacub
Reviews.Content: I reside in San Diego but chose The Lafayette for a week-end stay, due to its location and low rates. The Lafayette was due for a condo conversion a few years ago but the plans were halted, which accounts for the unfinished state of some renovations and projected improvements. I would hesitate to recommend The Lafayette for a visiting family, since it is a bit aways from most tourist attractions, though only slightly farther than properties in Hotel Circle and downtown, and only two bus lines (11 and 15) stop near the hotel. Also, during my stay there were a couple of private functions (receptions and the like) so people gathered poolside and at the outdoor grill until late hours (Saturday night) which could be problematic for those desiring earlier bedtimes. Still, for any guests unconcerned by mild noise levels, a bit of peeling paint here and there, and willing to walk a half-mile to the fun restaurants and bars of University Heighs and Hillcrest, you can't beat it! The staff were friendly and professional, and I experienced no problems with water or room temperature (my room had a unit which served as both heater and A/C). I for one am glad it's still a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: traveler142
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms on the internet. Neither room had heat and the water was never more than luke warm. The electricity went out in one of the rooms the first night. There was no manager on site to help us resolve the problems.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view?”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Sailor
Reviews.Content: The stay started out nicely enough... very secure underground parking, well-decorated lobby, room was decent. The problems started a few nights later... I was using the bathroom in the middle of the night, and discovered a light coming from behind the bathroom mirror. Looking closely, there was a room behind the mirror, and someone had left the light on in there. VERY sketchy. This was in the Roy Rogers Room. If you end up staying here, and they give you this room (2nd floor), ask to change rooms. I checked out early after that. To add insult, they later billed me for an extra night's stay, and wouldn't refund the money. I'm sure in the past this was a very nice hotel, swimming with celebrities and swooning fans. However, it is now just an old building in a run down part of town, I don't even know what to do about the peep holes.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel pool ever”
Reviews.Author: jamcquay
Reviews.Content: The rooms are so-so and the walls between rooms are paper thin but the outdoor heated pool makes up for it. (NOTE: The hot tun as of November 3rd, 2007 is under construction). This hotel is not central and requires a bus ride to the downtown (number 15 goes right to broadway so no problems there). The bar in the hotel was actually pretty decent as locals from the area also go there... I would stay here again just for the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rromy
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the half moon driveway, I knew we made the right decision to stay at the Lafayette Hotel Inn and Suites. It was like a southern scene. The hotel staff were great and the ambience of the lobby, lounge and patio areas gave you a very warm feeling. Just beautiful!!! Our room was nice, not great. We had a king room on the 2nd floor and the view out the window left alot to be desired. Roof top only. The bathrooms need a little grout work, but it was okay. We just really liked the whole experince in general. The bartenders are very friendly and make sure you have what you need. The outside patio areas are very inviting and a beautiful scene. The Red Fox Restaurant on the premises takes you back to a different era which was very cool. Good food and warm ambience, decent prices. We really had a good time staying here; it was close proximity to everything we wanted to see and do in the San Diego area. The El Cajon Boulevard area the hotel is on is very nostalgic looking. Nothing to be afraid of. You will not be dissappointed staying at The Lafayette Hotel. Try to get a poolside with patio room. We will next time for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up - we had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: gmossfish
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lafayette for three nights about two weeks ago and I was frightened about what I had read. I almost changed my hotel reservations, but I am glad I didn't. It is NOT terrible. We found it to be charming and a great deal! The pool was never crowded and the pool bottom is NOT mold, it is a pebble like bottom. Very nice pool. Breakfast was great. Plenty of choices and eating on the patio was lovely. Our room was small, but we didn't spend a whole lot of time in it. After all, we were on vacation and it was perfect for us (mom, dad, and two small children.) The hotel was quiet, even during the middle of the day for nap time. Location was good. We couldn't afford the beach, but this was close to everything. We never felt unsafe and the car was in a secured underground lot. I expected to come back and chew them up like everyone else, but instead I feel like they have been wrongly accused. We enjoyed everything about our stay and we would stay there again. I am really baffled how my stay could have gone so differently from so many others. I have stayed at the Ritz and this is not that, but it was charming, comfortable, nice, and we really enjoyed it. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: hammah
Reviews.Content: Pool was overcrowded, other guests not very courteous with respect to quiet hours and it persisted even after complaint, room was fair at best, poolside door did not latch which raised safety concerns for our property and child. I tried to make the best of it, but it was the worst hotel experience I can recall.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: traveling_galArizona
Reviews.Content: I booked 10 rooms for a family reunion, based on a stay at the property several years ago. I checked the hotel's website and spoke at length with the reservation agent. I was assured that the rooms had been updated and remodeled. Upon arrival I was very disappointed to see the worn and shoddy condition of the rooms. Carpet was bare and the upholstery on the furniture was threadbare. The bathrooms were in need of repair. The tile was loose and the general appearance of the room and bathroom was old and worn. The airconditioning was noisy abnd ineffieient. We also were not told of the policy that the bar has if you come in and by a drink you have pool privileges. So during the day and into the evening the pool area was over crowded and there were no chairs or lounges available for the registered guests. Not to mention the the questionable character of some of those people. Our group was most uncomfortable. On the evening of Labor Day there was a loud group with loud music until 11 PM when we complained to management. It took several complaints to have the music quieted. Needless to say we were very disappointed and will never stay at this property again and would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “its ok for the price, dont expect much”
Reviews.Author: p44
Reviews.Content: Initially we were little bit worried after reading the reviews.But we found it ok to stay.Breakfast is also ok but think need a bit variation.No bath tub,prbably because its a very old Hotel.Swimming pool is nice but not temperature controlled.in short don't expect too much because you have not paid that much.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: miles661ca
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Sand Diego after driving 5 hours from Bakersfield, CA. We left after a work event and made it to the "room" around 2 AM. Exhausted, we crashed immediately. We awoke to a filthy, dated room. There was mold in the bathroom tub area. The overall dissrepair of the bathroom raised concerns for our safety: The shelves and vanity wobbled on the wall; the wall-attached dryer was filthy; the exhaust vent was monted to the wall with dry-wall screws, the tissue dispenser fell out of the wall when I tried to remove a Kleenex; and worst of all the safety bar for the tub hung from the wall by a single screw with gaping holes into the tile and wall behind it. I could go on and on about the Horrible experience we had here but I'll le the pictures speak for themselves...

Reviews.Title: “Good Value For the Money.”
Reviews.Author: billerb
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of negative reviews on this property, which scared me. Everything is relative, though, and one must bear that in mind. This property is decent. I paid $129 per night mid-week in August of 2007. It was sold out while I was there and the guest make-up was mostly young families and some European tourists. I was with my wife and two children - 4 and 1 1/2 years old. The property is old, so don't expect what you would find at the Hilton or Four Seasons. The rooms are decent and clean, although you can tell that they have not been updated in some time (30 years?). The place is not a "dump" as others have described, although there are some broken tiles in the bathrooms, the carpets are not immaculate, the furniture is scratched, the bathtub/shower is not pristine, etc. Breakfast is included, and they offer a waffle bar (always a line of people), fruit, cereal, toast, bagels, juices and milk. The pool is clean and decent. Our stay of three nights was quiet, and we were in a pool-side room in the back corner (don't remember the name or number of the "suite"). The Internet access was free and moderate in speed. The staff was not overly-friendly, but was not rude either, like others have suggested. Bottom line: the hotel is centrally-located in a moderate neighborhood (there are some adult clubs nearby), and for the money - in San Diego - it is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Lafayette Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GolferFolks
Reviews.Content: Old Hotel but refurbished somewhat. The Lobby is very nice but the rooms need some work. Our room was roomy. Bathroom is small with no space for toiletry items. Painting was drab in bathroom. The continental breakfast was average. Parking is free in an underground garage that is only accessble by your room key card so it is secure. Staff was average in service. Location is not in downtown San Diego but a short drive to all tourist places. We ate dinner at the restaurant in the hotel and it was nice. The best part for our party of four was the Chicken Pie Shop that is down the street. For $6.00 we got the best meal deal in town. And it was good!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty!!! You could not pay me to stay here again. Horrible!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tracyandjjtravels
Reviews.Content: Dear Travel friends, We all spend so much money to go somewhere nice. We work hard all year, and really look forward to vacation dont we? PLEASE, do not stay here. The hotel room had bugs, mold, hard beds and was dirty. It has NOT been renovated like the web site says, the place in the 1940s was probably very nice. But it is now a mold infested, dump. PLEASE trust my opinion. I have traveled 50% of the time for the last 22 years and this was the worst ever!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: wizbang11
Reviews.Content: Hi, We checked in and found the room we were promised was not the one we received. the room they gave us had mold on the walls and in the bathroom. The place was run down. In a high crime rate area, which is not obvious untill you get there. The room smelled, the beds were lumpy. And the tenants from the run down apartments all around the hotel use the hotels pool and facilities as an extension of their own apartment. A very ugly place to stay. Then to make things worse, when we told the Front Desk that we needed another room, they didn't have one. So we checked out and they charged my credit card anyway. And as of 3 months later have refused to reverse the charge. So I have had to dispute the charge with my credit card company. A terrible place for a vacation or even a quick stay. Plus this is not a family friendly environment. That is unless you don't mind used condoms and drug needles in the parking lot and in the nearby streets. And I have to mention the neighbors arguing about drugs all night long.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, but at what cost? Never again!”
Reviews.Author: lightbe
Reviews.Content: We were looking for, and expecting "old world charm" that was advertised. Our room had a strange smell, the air conditioner was very noisy, the stuffing was coming out of our mattress, there was no cover on the electrical outlet, and there were stains on the wall in the bathroom. I know all of this sounds bad, but knowing how much it costs to get a room in San Diego, I could have put up with the lack of "charm" in the room. What was inexcusable is the lack of respect we received from some of the front desk staff. One of them gave me the wrong directions to drive to a pharmacy. After driving for miles, I turned around and came back to the hotel. Then the clerk insisted she never told me how to get to the pharmacy, and called me a liar!! Another front desk clerk insulted me and accused me of "crashing" in the lobby when I was sitting and doing a Sudoku puzzle, and closed my eyes for a minute. I have stayed at some very nice hotels, but I have also stayed at the less expensive motels, and I have never had the staff speak to me like this, or call me names. The place is a bargain, pricewise, but I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Oh please, this hotel was super duper! Whats all the fuss?”
Reviews.Author: lolasanfrancisco
Reviews.Content: I have to say, I was expecting a dump run by evil little snots. However, what I did find was a amazing room, overlooking a fab pool and jacuz, with pool side waiter service. The staff was sweet, and even when I spilled a dring all overmyself like a dumb-bo they ran over, cleaned it up, poored me another and didn't charge me. Come on, this is not a 5 star Hyatt, this is a funky local hotel that I am going to stay at everytime I come back, and thats 2x a year.

Reviews.Title: “The Good,the Bad and the Ugly.Not Good ”
Reviews.Author: cracal
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reveiws on this hotel we decided to take a chance for a trip down memory lane given this hotels history, this is where we come to the only good feature. The hotel was obviously grand in its day, the entrance and reception area have some great features "BUT" it's all been renovated on the cheap and once away from this area we come to the real story as mentioned in previous reviews its a dump. We are very seasoned traveller and have stayed in all type of hotels,motels etc all over the world and know what to expect from most places but ths place is just too misleading. We had a newly renovated room with balcony overlooking the pool (sounds good huh? ....well it wasn't!) the room was quite large but had a very odd smell, renovated meaning a lick of paint on a 60 year old door and someone had brushed the carpet. The balcony had a flooring of sharp loose gravel, very dirty old plastic chairs and a palm tree which encrouched into the room! The pool and this is probably unfair but it just looked dirty and so we didn't use it. Breakfast comes free but once again cheap produce and pretty much on a first come basis (don't leave it late). All in all we had pre booked and payed online through expedia (Â£50 per night) but we found it in a hotel voucher book we picked up in vegas but it wasn't called the Lafayette it just said inns & suites you could tell by the photo and the address and was $89 + tax about the same money so our advice would be look before you buy.

Reviews.Title: “Problems”
Reviews.Author: TifGreen7
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through a website for my family, for my Brother-In Law's b-day celebration. We drove into town from AZ expecting a long weekend in a nice hotel. The hotel staff, is not the nicest around. We called once from the road to see if we could check in early. They told us to call back in a couple of hours, we did and they promptly replied no. We had a sick family member with us. We got to the lobby and were told, we can have a room available in 20 min, great, it was better than nothing. 30 min passed and another couple walked in from the street and they were checked in, in no time. More time passed and eventually we were checked into both rooms, they upgraded us both to suites, we were satisfied. The room was old, we expected that. They had new carpet installed and some nice queen sized beds. The ceilings have major water damage and there are some nails sticking out of the ground due to the new flooring installed. The bathrooms were small, but cute. The shower itself was possessed; you either had really, really hot water, or really cold water. The drain didn't work; it would fill up as you showered. Then the next morning we found a roach. Yup on the side of the drapes, there it was a huge one. My mother in law caught it, they offered to have it taken out of the room and were told by maintenance that it was due to the flooring being put in. They offered us to switch rooms, but we figured hey, it's the flooring, it makes sense. We stayed. The next morning, we leave early, come back in the evening, and there is another one in our bedroom again. This time we call the staff downstairs and they stateâ€� weâ€™ve never had a complaint about roaches" We state, well we called yesterday about one. They come up to get this one and then say, that it was due to the party they had the other night. In all, it made us not want to stay there again. You can excuse one as just chance and then 2 in a row means something is wrong there. Maybe we should have changed rooms, but you would think that charging $148 a night would be enough for them to make sure that they get an exterminator there. I would have loved to have a great nights sleep, but wondering what could be living under my bed was not good. The second night of finding one left us with a bad taste in our mouths. I read reviews about this place and thought to give it a chance. My partner and I wanted to stay there for PRIDE weekend, but we're better off staying at an overpriced motel that at least will keep bugs out.

Reviews.Title: “Not as grand as it was but acceptable”
Reviews.Author: bb1769
Reviews.Content: We had a good experience staying here for two nights. Yes, the hotel was once much more upscale, and some of the fixtures and windows are original from 1946. But it was reasonably clean and they are doing some renovations. The lobby and pool areas are quite attractive--nice experience having breakfast overlooking the pool. It's not in the most attractive area of San Diego, but it's not dangerous either (I grew up in San Diego).

Reviews.Title: “Clean basic accommodation”
Reviews.Author: lumasabe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lafayette for 1 week in April 2007. We booked a poolside room which was old but very clean. The beds were comfy and everything worked. We had plenty of hot water (family of 4) and never ran out. The air conditioning was extremely noisy. The front desk staff are polite but unfriendly - none of them ever cracked a smile once in the whole week we were there! Bar staff and maids were nice and requests for things such as fresh towels were brought to your room almost straight away. Our kids enjoyed the pool but parents should be aware that it is a public pool and quite a few of the locals use it and the bar in the afternoons. Breakfast provided was good with a waffle maker and cereal/toast etc. It was quieter in the breakfast room on weekdays but from Friday onwards it was crowded and hard to get a table - eat early! The Lafayette is in walking distance to quite a few diners/restaurants and we never felt unsafe walking at night back to the hotel after a meal. Coco's Bakery Restaurant is probably the best to get a good meal at a reasonable price. Overall our stay at the Lafayette was good and it provided a good base with all we needed for our family holiday. We stayed there for one more night at the end of our holiday in a different poolside room and it was just the same as our first one - old but very clean and comfortable. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel sucked!”
Reviews.Author: chiil23
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel i've ever stayed at. I wish i would have visited tripadvisor prior to going. The hotel is very old and worn out. The room was filthy. The hotel staff looked as miserable working there as i did staying there. They were very unfriendly and in serious need of etiquette training. It's bad enough to stay in a dump like this, but to have a staff as uncaring as they were made it even worse. The pictures online are very deceiving. This hotel should be condemned. There was not one single thing pleasant about this hotel that i can think of. My advice to all who may be considering a stay at this hotel...stay away! Proceed at your own risk. You could not pay me to stay at that decrepit dump again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hated it!”
Reviews.Author: rosieb45
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Lafayette Hotel was not friendly or professional in any way. If you do not need hot water, air conditioning, that works, and a staff that actually tries to control their rowdy guests then this is the place for you. The room next to ours was rented to at least 8 Spring Breakers. They screamed and yelled all night until around 3AM. Between banging on the walls, trying to get into our room via the pass door and other assorted nonsense we didn't get a night's sleep. At one point we were thinking of calling the police. The screams sounded more like an attack in progress than partying. We were there on business which made it worse. I called the front desk the next morning and no apologies were offered. I called Orbitz for a refund which I was promptly given and found a beautiful professionally run hotel in downtown San Diego. This hotel may have been something in it's day but it needs a complete make-over and a new staff! The only decent thing there was the "Red Foxx Room" Great steaks and very nice wait staff.
